label: List of slaves belonging to "The Wilsons" under Mortgage to Thomas Drayton, February 20, 1807
description: List of slaves belonging to "The Wilsons" (Algernon and Thomas Wilson?) under mortgage to Thomas Drayton. The list includes sections devoted to the names of slaves who had died or been sold while under mortgage. Includes a note from Thomas Smith Grimke seeking more information.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: List of slaves belonging to "The Wilsons" (Algernon and Thomas Wilson?) under mortgage to Thomas Drayton. The list includes sections devoted to the names of slaves who had died or been sold while under mortgage. Includes a note from Thomas Smith Grimke seeking more information.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information and reuse requirements contact Special Collections at Addlestone Library, College of Charleston, Charleston, SC, 29424.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 600 dpi, 24-bit depth, color, Epson Expression 10000XL, Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
The Wilsons Negroes under Mortgage to JD 20 Feb. 1807-

Returned in [Schidrile?]

[1]
Ned
[Lary?]
Charles
Sancho
Darby
James
Frank
Sally
Joe

[2]
William- Dead
Mat- do
Phillis- do
Nancy- do
[Grinda?]- do
Harry- do
Maria- do
July- do

[3]
Betsey Sold
Beck
Mary
Rose
Chloe
Linson
Will
March
Sue
Patty
[Panduche?]
HEctor
Jack

Algernon Wilson's Negroes under Mortgage to JD 10 Feb. 1807

[1]
Amez- dead
Dinah do
Miles- dead
Jack- do
Rachael- do
Allen- do
John- do

[2]
Kate
Moses
[illegible]
Harvy
[Pha?]
Mauvice
Joe
[illegible]hio
Chloe
Philips
Dinah
Mile

Will Sir to do me the favor to specify when the
negroes in column No 3 were sold and under what
[illegible] or Mortgage each was sold- Also whether
none of A [lots?] have been sold- If so- then by what
authority- Will be to also aversion with res-
pect to the ride-
can Mr Wilson specify the items and dates of money
last which compose the 3 Notes to Mr D.

JSG

Mr G will see what time No 3. Negroes were sold by the Sheriffs Receipt and on what
Judgt. they were sold- you have [illegible] papers- the sheriffs [Receipt?] mentions all the Names
